mobs.keywords: fire-salamander salamander fire lizard liz sal salam
mobs.long_desc: A fire salamander is here, prowling through the tunnels.
mobs.desc: This beast is well suited to the tunnels of this volcano. The fire salamander prowls through the tunnels on all four feet, and although it does not look very agile, you have no doubt it is capable of lightning speed.

mobs.long_desc: A fiery form flows in your direction.
mobs.desc: This creature shifts shapes rapidly as its fiery form flows in a new direction. The only thing constant about the sprite is its eyes, which burn emerald green and glare at you with a terrible purpose.

mobs.long_desc: A lava beast stands proudly before you, guarding his mistress.
mobs.desc: Unlike many of the other denizens of this volcano, this beast lacks any hint of malice or evil in its eyes. Rather, the look it gives you as you survey it is one of pure calm. The beast itself seems to be composed of molten lava; dark spots form on its frame as the lava cool at regular intervals, only to be swallowed by warmer lava which flows over its body from deeper within.

mobs.long_desc: The shadows seem to flicker oddly in this room ...
mobs.desc: You have trouble focusing on this creature, for it seems to be made of darkness and flows quickly from place to place. You note with some concern that the darkness seems to be stretching out an arm towards you...

mobs.long_desc: A dancing flame brushes by you.
mobs.desc: This wisp of flame seems unaware of your presence as it swirls and twists along the passageway. Although its fire burns dim, at irregular intervals it flares up in a bright light that makes you squint in pain.

mobs.long_desc: Vulcera is here, admiring her reflection in a small hand-held mirror.
mobs.desc: Red-haired and bronze-skinned, Vulcera is unlike any woman you have ever seen before. But then, her lineage is of unique origin. Her odd physical attributes enhance her physical beauty, rather than detract from it. You find yourself becoming charmed by her physical beauty and as you tear your eyes away from her, you remind yourself of the evil that this near-immortal has spawned.

mobs.long_desc: Ashes from the floor flow together and coalesce into the form of an ash daemon!
mobs.desc: As you look upon this foul spirit you are overwhelmed by a sense of tremendous wrong. Not content with the evil deeds it committed as a mortal, it refused to abandon the material plane upon its death. It took up sanctuary here, in the forsaken tunnels of the volcano, where it could continue to express its evil nature.

mobs.long_desc: A pillar of ash rises from the floor and coalesces into an ash lord!
mobs.desc: You repress a wave of nausea as you gaze upon this creature. The ash lord is a collage of several different spirits, united to form a single being capable of more heinous crimes than any one alone. Although its evil is palpable, what truly revolts you is the knowledge that it lives for evil, and for no other purpose.

mobs.long_desc: A swirling cloud of smoke comes to rest before you.
mobs.desc: Hovering before you is a smoky form.  Your first glance dismisses the form as nothing to be afraid of, an insubstantial nuisance at the very most.  But if it can cause you no harm, why does it advance towards you with such purpose?

mobs.long_desc: A pasty-skinned boy nervously twitches here.
mobs.desc: This small boy has the palest skin you have ever seen.  He must have spent a long time away from the light of the sun, inside the caverns of this fiery volcano.  Although he is small and awkward, his movements hint at grace and speed.  His eyes flicker constantly about the passage, looking for signs of danger.

mobs.long_desc: A snarling beast made of ash glares at you from the shadows.
mobs.desc: As you look into the vacant eyes of this beast you realize that it lacks intelligence of any kind. You doubt that this ashy frame entombs an evil spirit; more likely, the beast was conjured by some dark magic.

mobs.long_desc: a Jungle Tribe warrior is startled by your presence.
mobs.desc: The warrior is a man that has been tempered by the harsh environment of this seemingly lush island.  His small frame hides a fierceness that was bred by the jungle from which the tribe takes its name, and fueled by desperate battles against other island natives and the horrible monsters that issue forth from the mouth of the volcano.

mobs.long_desc: The warlord stands proudly before you.
mobs.desc: The most accomplished warrior of the Jungle Tribe, this man has proven his worth over his opponents time and time again.  His naked chest proudly displays a dozen battle scars.  His face shows a deep grief, however, and you wonder what has caused this noble warrior such pain.

mobs.long_desc: A shaman stands here looking thoughtful.
mobs.desc: This man is far older than any of the other natives you have seen on this island, which is odd considering the number of ways to die in the vicinity. Perhaps there is more to him than meets the eye.

mobs.long_desc: A head-hunter looks at you and sees dinner.
mobs.desc: This man is nude except for a thin loincloth which he wears about his waist. His skin is decorated with paints of varying shades that allow him to blend almost perfectly with the jungle.

mobs.keywords: chief warrior hunter red-skinned head-hunter bone-tribe-chief
mobs.long_desc: A red-skinned Bone Tribe head-hunter challenges you to notice him.
mobs.desc: Like the other head-hunters you have seen, the chief wears nothing but a tattered loincloth about his waist.  However, his skin is painted bright red rather than in the blending jungle colors of his subordinates.  It is almost as if he is challenging you to notice him.

mobs.long_desc: A furry red ape stares at you from behind a bush.
mobs.desc: Although it carries no weapons, this creature is endowed with a physical prowess that is a weapon in itself. You see death in its beady black eyes.

mobs.long_desc: A dispirited dwarrow is here, examining the stones of this tunnel.
mobs.desc: This miserable Mountain Tribe dwarrow, a subrace of dwarf, has suffered enormously under the hands of his tormenters.  Cursed with the knowledge of stone, he has been forced for untold years to carve passageways through this volcano for his master Vulcera.

mobs.long_desc: A young woman is here, nursing a baby.
mobs.desc: This young Jungle Tribe women looks hardy, capable of bearing the harsh environment of this island.  You would not be surprised were you to see her pick up a spear to defend her tribe.

mobs.long_desc: The three heads of a terrible beast swivel towards you.
mobs.desc: You tremble as you gaze upon this fearsome creature. Surely this beast was spawned by dark magic for you cannot imagine nature would fashion such a loathsome beast. The chimera has three heads, the body of a lion, and the limbs of a goat. Its three heads-- lion, goat and dragon-- glare at you balefully.

mobs.long_desc: A giant spider peers at you from a branch.
mobs.desc: You can hardly believe the size of this spider! It is as large as a dog and seems adapted at prowling along tree branches. As the spider creeps towards you, you begin to wonder if a creature this size feeds exclusively on flies and insects.

mobs.long_desc: A tree with withering vines blocks the path.
mobs.desc: This tree is draped with numerous vines. As you approach the tree, the vines seem to twitch slightly. Perhaps it was only your imagination.

mobs.long_desc: A fierce dwarrow stands here, determined to keep the tunnel a secret.
mobs.desc: This dirty creature is unlike any dwarf you have ever before seen.  Her copper-bronze skin and radiant copper hair, markers of the Mountain Tribe of the island, are quite different from other dwarves.  She stands before you defiantly, determined not to allow you to extinguish the hope which burns so fervently in her eyes.

mobs.long_desc: An elderly dwarrow woman of the Mountain Tribe is here, sitting on a thin blanket.
mobs.desc: An ancient woman, this matriarch of the Mountain Tribe seems determined to keep her clan together.  As you peer into her wise brown eyes you have little doubt she will do everything possible to see that her dwarven people are one day united in freedom.

mobs.long_desc: A Jungle Tribe child stands here, looking sweet and innocent.
mobs.desc: Awwww what a cute kid. Give her a hug and a kiss.

mobs.long_desc: A Jungle Tribe child stands here, looking sweet and innocent.
mobs.desc: This kid is awfully cute, but... her eyes are cold and flat, and the grin she fixes you with seems rather malicious.

mobs.long_desc: A shapeless mass of stone shifts slightly as you approach.
mobs.desc: This mass of stone seems to have no definitive shape, and were it not for the fact that is quivers slightly, you would easily dismiss it as nothing out of the ordinary.

mobs.long_desc: A dispirited Mountain Tribe dwarrow is here, examining the stones of this tunnel.
mobs.desc: This miserable Mountain Tribe dwarrow, a subrace of dwarf, has suffered enormously under the hands of his tormenters.  Cursed with the knowledge of stone, he has been forced for untold years to carve passageways through this volcano for his master Vulcera.

mobs.long_desc: A crudely formed statue made of stone stares at you.
mobs.desc: This statue is about two meters high. His stone body is very rigid but his eyes move about freely, searching for intruders...

mobs.long_desc: A Bone Tribe head-hunter looks at you and sees dinner.
mobs.desc: This man is nude except for a thin loincloth which he wears about his waist. His skin is decorated with paints of varying shades that allow him to blend almost perfectly with the jungle.

mobs.long_desc: A fiery form flows in your direction.
mobs.desc: This creature shifts shapes rapidly as its fiery form flows in a new direction. The only thing constant about the sprite is its eyes, which burn emerald green and glare at you with a terrible purpose.

mobs.long_desc: A small man sitting at a table in the back of the room looks up from his meal.
mobs.desc: Jemnon does not look particularly powerful or able.  If he were standing, he would probably be just over 5' 4".  Something about the way he sits, scanning the room, radiates confidence.  His blue eyes shine with optimism, despite several noticable scars peppering his otherwise attractive face.

mobs.long_desc: McCabe stands tall, muttering some incantation.
mobs.desc: Mccabe is tall and thin, with a black, curly, double-beard.  His long robes drape over his feet, and trail behind him.  His eyes seem distant, like he is a little detatched from reality.

mobs.long_desc: An unsuspecting seagull flies overhead.
mobs.desc: This poor bird looks frazzled. It's ruffles feathers seem singed and sooty in places.

objects.ground: A crude spear with an obsidian head lies here.

extras.text: This spear has a short haft and a broad obsidian head.  It has poor balance and you doubt that it would make an effective missile weapon.  However the obsidian head is very sharp, and you feel confident you could inflict a great deal of damage with it.

objects.ground: A seashell glittering with rainbow hues uplifts your spirit.

extras.text: You can't help but be entranced by this beautiful shell.  As large as your hand, it is striated with rainbow colors that glitter in the light.  You know this shell would sell for a high price in any market, but do you really want to part with the sea's breathtaking work of art?

objects.ground: A fragile pink necklace catches your eye.

extras.text: The coral necklace is made up of a variety of different pieces of coral.  This coral is brightly colored; whether the coral's coloration is natural or the result of pigments applied by the savages, you are unsure of.  In any event, it is a very pretty piece of jewelry.

objects.ground: A dagger with a slick black blade lies here.

extras.text: The obsidian blade of this dagger has been sharpened to perfection.  It is a wonder that such a slovenly people would take such good care of their weapons. The dagger is a bit heavy but would make a fine weapon.

objects.ground: The shrivelled head of a Jungle tribesman lies here.

extras.text: This grotesque trophy makes you want to puke.  Why would you ever want to look at such a thing??

objects.ground: A necklace made of white stones gleams in the sun.

extras.text: This necklace is composed of several die-sized pieces of bone connected by a stout throng.  Each bone is crudely decorated with symbols that you assume are religious in nature.

objects.ground: A crude spear with a white head lies here.

extras.text: This spear has a short haft and a broad bone head.  This spear has poor balance and you doubt that it would make an effective missile weapon.  However the bone head is very sharp, and you feel confident you could inflict a great deal of damage with it.

objects.ground: A ratty pair of boots has been discarded here.

extras.text: At first glance these boots appear to have been tossed aside after years of use. They are ragged and torn, and look about your size. You begin to turn from your inspection of these boots, when something odd catches your eye. You can't quite place your finger on it, but there is something very unusual about these boots.

objects.ground: A bone dagger has been abandoned here.

extras.text: The blade of this dagger has been made from a single piece of bone.  Doubting that a weapon made of bone could be sharp enough to be effective in battle, you run your expect thumb along the blade, and promptly cut yourself.

objects.ground: A jewel burning with an intense inner light lies here.

extras.text: This jewel is the size of your fist!  Beneath its multifaceted surface you perceive an intense reddish light so intense it seems a reflection of Vulcera's fiery passion and hot desires.

objects.ground: A dagger wreathed in flame lies here.

extras.text: You watch in amazement as flickering tongues of flame race up and down this blade.  The blade of this dagger is hot to the touch and a dull red in color; the handle of the dagger itself, however, is surprisingly cool.

objects.ground: A crown made of a slick, black stone lies here.

extras.text: This crown is simple.  Neither gemstone nor precious metal decorate its surface.  However, there is an aura of power about this crown that makes you catch your breath.

objects.ground: A battered old pail lies here.

extras.text: This dented iron bucket has seen much use. The inside of this bucket is covered in a fine powder of ash. It seems the dwarrows gather ash in these buckets and pile it here, in the ash tunnels. You wonder why they would do such a thing.

objects.ground: An ivory wedding band has been tossed here by a spiteful person.

extras.text: This simple wedding band was made by Vulcera's husband-to-be, the Lord of the Moonless Night.  The band was created to symbolize their eternal love for one another; that love died long ago, and now the ring lies cold and lifeless.

objects.ground: A heavily engraved ivory chest is pushed against the far wall.

extras.text: Before you lies a massive chest, fashioned from pure ivory. A number of runes decorate the surface of the chest. A simple silver lock is all that prevents you from opening the chest and grabbing the fabulous treasures that surely lie within.

objects.ground: An ivory key lies here, collecting dust.

extras.text: This key feels unwholesome somehow.

objects.ground: A scroll lies here in the dirt, it seems some questor died and left it here... muhahahahahahaha!

extras.text: TURN THIS SCROLL IN TO A GOD WHEN YOU ARE DONE (please).

objects.ground: A fiery key lies here.
A heavily engraved ivory chest dominates this simple room.

extras.text: Before you lies a massive chest, fashioned from pure ivory. A number of runes decorate the surface of the chest. A simple silver lock is all that prevents you from opening the chest and grabbing the fabulous treasures that surely lie within.

objects.ground: A sheet of parchment soaked in blood lies here.

extras.text: This appears to be a map of the volcano! You curse your luck as you look at the parchment for it is soaked in blood. The blood has washed away most of the markings on the paper; however, one section of the parchment is free of blood and you see crude drawing depicting a person descending into a pit. There also appears to be part of a spell written on here, but again the blood has obliterated most of the words.

objects.ground: A small hand-held mirror reflects your brutal features.

extras.text: Ick! Who is that staring back at you!

objects.ground: The severed head of a dragon oozes blood here.

extras.text: The size of a large cow, the head has been severed part-way down the neck, leaking thick, scarlet blood.  The scales are dull, chipping easily at the edges.  One large glassy eye seems to have popped, oozing viscous whitish fluid all over the dragon's snout.

objects.ground: A small stone necklace lies here.
A frail crown made of ash crumbles slowly here.

extras.text: You are baffled at how this crown even stays together!  It looks to be made entirely of loose ash.

objects.ground: A sheet of parchment lies here.

extras.text: You can make out a series of words on the parchment but they are in no language you recognise.

objects.ground: A cloak burns here and yet is not consumed.
An ivory wedding band has been tossed here by a spiteful person.
The severed head of a goat sticks its tongue out, a final tidings to the world.

extras.text: Grotesque and ugly, the severed goat's head oozes blood from its neck just below the jawbone.  Its whitish hair is stained and matted, clumping and sticking in knots.  A limp pinkish tongue droops out of its mouth between rows of vicious-looking teeth, forming a puddle of horrid-smelling drool beneath it.

objects.ground: A fearsome expression of wrath is locked on the face of a severed lion's head.

extras.text: Once golden-haired with a beautiful, rich brown mane, this lion's head is now severed from its body, clotted blood matting the edges of its hair.  A terrible expression of wrath and anguish is locked onto its face, hinting at its agonizing downfall.  Much of the insides of the head have long fallen out, leaving a hideously gross interior large enough to fit another head in.

objects.ground: A turquoise piece of cloth with the words 'ash-lord-status' on lies here.
A bright blue piece of cloth with the words 'ash-lord-alive' on it is here.
A grey piece of cloth with the words ash-lord-dead lies here.
A piece of green material with the words got-ivory-key lies here.
A purple piece of cloth with the words change-rock-monster lies here.
A conch shell horn awaits a new owner.
objects.action_desc: A strident call blasts from the conch horn!

extras.text: This horn is made from a traditional spiral sea snail shell.  Unlike many other horns of this type however, a small mouthpiece has been affixed to the narrow end of the shell, making it easier to blow through and create its signature bugling.

objects.ground: A tiny burning meteorite is hovering here, plummetting endlessly towards the ground.

extras.text: Flaming and hot, this chunk of interstellar rock is in a perpetual state of falling even though it never moves.  Flames streak out behind it leaving a glowing trail through the sky.  The tangy smell of ozone suffuses the air around the burning rock.  Whatever journey this meteorite has been on, it must have been a long one!

objects.ground: A tiny burning meteorite is hovering here, plummetting endlessly towards the ground.

extras.text: Flaming and hot, this chunk of interstellar rock is in a perpetual state of falling even though it never moves.  Flames streak out behind it leaving a glowing trail through the sky.  The tangy smell of ozone suffuses the air around the burning rock.  Whatever journey this meteorite has been on, it must have been a long one!

triggers.name: falling_from_48191
triggers.commands: if %direction% == west wait 5 set rndm %random.char% if !(%rndm.eff_flagged[FLY]%) wsend %rndm% You feel your feet start slipping toward the pit! wait 3 s if %rndm.room% == 48191 wsend %rndm% You slip into the pit! wechoaround %rndm% You watch in horror as %rndm.name% slips into the pit! wteleport %rndm% 48192 wforce %rndm% look endif unset rndm endif endif

triggers.name: open_volcano
triggers.commands: wat 48148 wecho There is a load groaning noise and a crack develops in the side of the volcano. wat 48147 wecho There is a load groaning noise and a crack develops in the side of the volcano. wait 2 s wat 48147 wecho Even as you watch the crack widens to the size of a doorway. wat 48148 wecho Even as you watch the crack widens to the size of a doorway. wdoor 48147 north room 48148 wdoor 48147 north description A passage leads into the heart of the volcano. wdoor 48148 south room 48147 wdoor 48148 south description You can see the sky through the doorway! wait 10 s wat 48147 wecho There is a load groaning noise and the doorway starts to close! wat 48148 wecho There is a load groaning noise and the doorway starts to close! wait 2 s wat 48147 wecho The volcano shudders as it seals the entrance. wat 48148 wecho The volcano shudders as it seals the entrance. wdoor 48147 north purge wdoor 48148 south purge

triggers.name: chimera_death
triggers.commands: mload obj 48122 mload obj 48128 mload obj 48129 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% lets out an arduous cry as %actor.name%'s attack lops its heads off! msend %actor% %self.name% lets out a cry as your attack rends its heads from its body.

triggers.name: hold_bloody_paper
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 4 osend %actor% You feel a burning pain in your hand as the magic tries to activate. odamage %actor% 50 osend %actor% You gasp in pain and drop the paper. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gasps in pain and drops the paper. oforce %actor% rem bloody-parchment oforce %actor% drop bloody-parchment wait 1 s osend %actor% The magic fails to activate, there is too much damage to the parchment. oechoaround %actor% The parchment glows for a second then fades. endif

triggers.name: hold_good_parchment
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 5 osend %actor% You feel a slight tickling sensation as the parchment draws strength from you to activate. odamage %actor% 20 osend %actor% You gasp in surprise and drop the paper. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% gasps in surprise and drops the paper. oforce %actor% rem parchment-paper oforce %actor% drop parchment-paper wait 2 oecho The parchment glows more and more brightly until you almost have to shield your eyes. if %actor.room% == 48197 set room %self.room% if %room.people[48127]% oforce rock-monster say I can feel the magic working! set stage 5 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% osend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done endif endif wait 2 s oecho The parchment suddenly stops glowing. endif

triggers.name: rock_monster_converting
triggers.argument_list: p I can feel the magic working!
triggers.commands: * this trigger only works if the rock-monster said the phrase if %actor.vnum% == 48127 wait 2 s wecho There is a swirling in the air and you see a face appear. wecho The face grins unpleasantly and then cackles. wait 1 s wecho The apparition says 'So, you dare to challenge Lokari?!' wecho The apparition glares at you. wait 1 s wecho The apparition says 'That was a pathetic piece of magic, did you think you could break my spell?  But I will remember that you tried...' wait 1 s wforce rock-monster emote wails in fear and pain as the transformation reasserts itself. wait 1 s wforce rock-monster emote turns to you in the instant before it returns to a pile of rock. wforce rock-monster mecho the rock monster says, 'Please kill me, and take the key I bear to Vulcera, my true love.' wait 1 s wecho The apparition says 'Pah, she could never love a mortal, your hearts are all made of stone.' wecho The apparition laughs at his own joke and fades. endif

triggers.name: ash_crown-get
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 set stage 3 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% osend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done endif

triggers.name: ivory-key-get
triggers.commands: set stage 6 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% osend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %victim.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %victim.name% osend %victim% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif

triggers.name: Ash crown give
triggers.commands: if %victim.vnum% == -1 if %victim.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 3 quest advance fieryisle_quest %victim.name% osend %victim% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif endif

triggers.name: wise_woman_give_parchment
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 48124 wait 2 mjunk %object% set stage 4 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% set accept yes quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %accept% == yes if !%get.mob_count[48107]% mat 1100 mload mob 48107 mat 1100 mforce ash-lord mload obj 48124 mat 1100 mforce ash-lord wear ash-crown mteleport ash-lord 48157 endif if !%get.mob_count[48127]% mat 48197 mload mob 48127 endif emote almost looks happy for a moment. mecho %self.name% says, 'Thank you %actor.name%, killing the ash lord avenges many of my people who have died under his rule.  The only thing I have of any value is a spell of reversal, which can reverse a shape change spell.' emote seems to consider for a short while. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'I already gave a copy of this to a young boy searching for his friend.' wait 3s sigh mecho %self.name% says, 'Perhaps he is dead now.  Here is another copy of it for you.' emote writes some words on a piece of parchment. mload obj 48125 give parchment %actor.name% wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'Best of luck in finding whatever or whomever you have lost. wait 2s whap wise-woman mecho %self.name% says, 'I almost forgot, to activate the spell, you must hold the parchment.' else if %actor.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% > %stage% mecho %self.name% says, 'I am not going to write you another spell.' else * quest stage < 4 or not started..how did they get the crown? glare %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'What is this insolence?  You hand me a crown without killing the Ash Lord.' emote crumbles the crown between her fingers. fume endif endif endif

triggers.name: chimera_cast
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 2 emote turns its dragon head to look at you. cast 'ray of enf' %actor% endif

triggers.name: bad_wedding_ring
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% != 48105 wait 2 oecho The ivory ring flares brightly! odamage %actor% 100 fire if %damdone% != 0 osend %actor% You are burnt by the ring and drop it! (&1&b%damdone%&0) oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% shouts in surprise and pain. (&1&b%damdone%&0) oforce %actor% drop ivory-ring if %actor.room% == 48223 oforce vulcera get ivory-ring endif end endif

triggers.name: VULCERA_gets_ring
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 48127 wait 2 wpurge ivory-ring wteleport vulcera 48209 wat 48209 wforce ai say vulcera-load-ring endif

triggers.name: Load rock monster
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 5 || %actor.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 6 if !%get.mob_count[48127]% wload mob 48127 endif endif

triggers.name: give_ivory_vulcera
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 8 wait 2 quest advance fieryisle_quest %actor.name% msend %actor% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 if !%get.mob_count[48127]% mat 48197 mload mob 48127 endif say You did well to find this, even with my powers I was unable to locate it.  On the other hand, you were a bit dumb to just hand it over to me!  It would seem Lokari taught me well. wait 3s unlock chest open chest get all chest emote examines the ivory ring. wait 2s say Pah, humans! if %self.inventory[48114]% mjunk ivory-ring endif mload obj 48127 wear ring wait 2s say Heh, it still fits after all these years, but Lokari won't be happy. mjunk key peer %actor.name% wait 2s mload obj 48126 wear cloak-fire say If you want this cloak, you better think again, begone mortal! mteleport all 48200 mat 48200 mecho You can hear Vulcera's laughter ringing in your ears. mgoto 48223 endif

triggers.name: vulcera_speak2
triggers.commands: wait 2 emote sighs loudly. mecho %self.name% says, 'Many years ago, I fell in love with a mortal man who wanted to wed me, but Lokari found out.' emot grimaces. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'He was very jealous.  Even though I saw him as a father, he must have felt something more.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'I haven't seen my fiance since, although Lokari swore that he did not kill him, and gave him the key to this chest should he ever return to claim me.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'In this chest is the ring he gave me to proclaim his love, which Lokari left as a reminder of how fickle mortals can be.' shrug wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'After all, if he really loved me, he would return and open the chest.' emote sighs again. wait 1s say If only someone could give me the key to the chest.

triggers.name: Load ivory key
triggers.commands: mload obj 48116

triggers.name: vulcera_greet1
triggers.commands: wait 6 peer %actor.name% say So puny one, you dare to disturb me? set stage 7 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %person.level% >= 60 if %person.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 wait 2 say What do you want pathetic mortal? else say Do you have what I require for the %weapon%? endif endif endif if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 if %person.inventory[48116]% wait 2 emote does a double take at %person.name%. say Are you the one who has the key to the ivory chest?! wait 1s bow %person.name% say If so you could end my punishment, I would make it worth your while. wait 2s emote mutters a brief incantation and a cloak of flames appears. msend %person% &7&bGroup credit will not be awarded for the next step.&0 endif endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done

triggers.name: pasty_receive1
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 48101 emote examines the shell. wait 2 cry mecho %self.name% says, 'This is a wonderful gift from my father, he forgives me for my cowardice.' hol shell wait 2 thanks %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'You have brought me hope in this dark place, so I will help you.' wait 1s think mecho %self.name% says, 'There is a pit near here which is very deep, but it has a side tunnel partway down.' wait 1s smile say I hope you find this information useful. endif

triggers.name: pasty_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Not long after I escaped in here, I met someone who had been changed into a pile of rock.' wait 2 frown mecho %self.name% says, 'It was strange though, it must have been Vulcera, but he never said a word against her.' wait 1s shrug emote waves a bloody piece of paper in your face. mecho %self.name% says, 'This was a spell of reversal to help him, but now I have no idea where he is.  Perhaps the wise woman will give you a spell too and we can search faster.' set stage 1 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done

triggers.name: pasty_greet1
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.vnum% == -1 emote mutters to himself. say Where has he gone? wait 2 peer %actor.name% say Could you help me find my friend? endif

triggers.name: UNUSED
triggers.commands: say Leave now, before Vulcera makes you hers! scan say Hurry!

triggers.name: warlord_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Yes, he was kidnapped by the Bone Tribe head-hunters for a sacrifice.' wait 1s spit mecho %self.name% says, 'Those headhunters are scum, and their chief is the worst of them.  If only I had warriors to spare, I could attack and kill him.' glare wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'He carries my father's shriveled head on his belt, and now he has taken my son too.'

triggers.name: warlord_receive1
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 48104 wait 2 mjunk severed-head smi say Ah, the enemy of my enemy is my friend. wait 1s sigh mecho %self.name% says, 'I cannot help but feel that my son is still alive, %actor.name%, but since none of my people have seen him he must be in the volcano.  I have too many responsibilities to leave and search for him.' sniff wait 1s mload obj 48101 mecho %self.name% says, 'If you find him, please give him this, and do all you can to help him.' set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if !%person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% quest start fieryisle_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have now begun the Fiery Island quest!&0 endif quest variable fieryisle_quest %person.name% shell 1 elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done give shell %actor.name% wait 2 say The island shaman will know more. endif

triggers.name: warlord_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 emote looks up quickly as you enter. sigh wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'I live in hope that my son will survive and return to me one day.' endif

triggers.name: shaman_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 sigh mecho %self.name% says, 'Yes, I remember the boy.  Small and pale skinned for his tribe, but he was fast enough when he got the chance to escape.  I was distracted for a second by Vulcera's pet and he nipped into the volcano I had opened.' fume wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'I think the volcano god is getting angry now for lack of blood.  Will you help us?'

triggers.name: shaman_receive1
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 48122 wait 2 mjunk head bow %actor.name% say You are indeed a mighty warrior.  Please have this gift as a token of my appreciation. mload obj 48123 give stone-necklace %actor.name% wait 1s consider %actor.name% wait 1s set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% set levelcheck 0 set queststart 0 set lowlevel 0 if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.level% >= 50 set levelcheck 1 if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% <= 1 if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 0 quest start fieryisle_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have now begun the Fiery Island quest!&0 endif set queststart 1 quest variable fieryisle_quest %person.name% chimera dead endif else msend %person% &1You are too low level to continue this quest.&0 set lowlevel 1 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done endif if %levelcheck% if %queststart% if %lowlevel% mecho %self.name% says, 'Some of you are still too inexperienced but...' wait 2s endif mecho %self.name% says, 'I wonder if you are mighty enough to take on Vulcera herself - we are sick of her spiteful acts against us.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'Of course, you would need the correct phrase to open the secret entrance to the volcano.  The phrase is &6&bbuntoi nakkarri karisto&0.' wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you find the son of the warlord inside, he may have gleaned some information about Vulcera.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'May the true volcano god look after you and help you destroy the usurper.' wait 5s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you forget what to do, you can come back to me and check on your &6&b[progress]&0.' else if %lowlevel% mecho %self.name% says, 'Some of you are still too inexperienced but...' wait 2s endif mecho %self.name% says, 'Remember, the mystic phrase to open the volcano is &6&b'buntoi nakkarri karisto'&0.  May the true volcano god guide you.' endif else mecho %self.name% says, 'You are a bit inexperienced to take on Vulcera, although you have done well to kill the chimera.  Thank you for your help, %actor.name%.  Perhaps we will meet again when you have seen more of the world.' endif

triggers.name: shaman_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Vulcera has prevented us from making our customary sacrifices by placing one of her...' wait 2 ponder wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, '"pets" in our sacred area before the volcano, and I fear that if we do not make a sacrifice soon...' wait 1s shrug say Well, the volcano will most likely blow up the island. sigh wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you can bring me the dragon head of the chimera, then I can reward you richly.' wink %actor.name%

triggers.name: shaman_greet1
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.vnum% == -1 say Welcome, adventurer, have you come to help us in our time of need? endif

triggers.name: headhunter_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 emote throws his head back and laughs heartily. ponder %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'That wimp who dares to call himself a warlord sent you, did he?  Well you won't find his son here.' wait 2 smirk mecho %self.name% says, 'We gave him to the shaman for a sacrifice to the volcano god.' wait 2 emote looks thoughtful. wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Although, the god does not seem to have been appeased yet, perhaps we need another candidate.' poke %actor.name%

triggers.name: chimera_greet1
triggers.commands: * *Added by Acerite oct 2004 * *Check for moonwell quest * if %actor.quest_stage[moonwell_spell_quest]% == 1 mjunk vine mload obj 16350 endif emote turns its dragon head to examine you. consider %actor.name% if %actor.level% < 30 cast 'dispel magic' %actor.name% else cast 'ray of enf' %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: chimera_fight1

triggers.name: chimera_fight2
triggers.commands: msend %actor.name% The chimera's lion head snaps at your legs, but you dodge. mechoaround %actor.name% %actor.name% dodges as the chimera's lion head snaps at them.

triggers.name: chimera_fight3
triggers.commands: msend %actor.name% The chimera's goat head snaps at you, just missing your arm! mechoaround %actor.name% %actor.name% sweats profusely as the chimera's goat head almost takes off their arm!

triggers.name: elder_woman_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 2 set stage 2 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == %stage% quest advance fieryisle_quest %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced your quest!&0 set ash 1 elseif %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 3 || %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 4 set ash 2 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %ash% == 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'If you want me to help you, then you must do me a favor.  Kill the ash lord and bring me his crown.' if %get.mob_count[48107]% < 1 mat 1100 mload mob 48107 mat 1100 mforce ash-lord mload obj 48124 mat 1100 mforce ash-lord wear crown mat 1100 mteleport ash-lord 48157 endif elseif %ash% == 2 say Bring me the ash lord's crown first. else say I have no idea what you are talking about. eye %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: vulcera_dead
triggers.commands: mecho The ivory ring seems to shimmer for a second. if %self.room% != 48223 mteleport all 48223 mecho &0 mecho &1&bA burning hole erupts, sucking everything through it!&0 mecho &0 set room %get.room[48223]% set person %room.people% while %person% if %person.vnum% == -1 mforce %person% look set person %person.next_in_room% endif done endif set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% == 9 quest variable fieryisle_quest %person% reward yes endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done * * Complete Fiery Island * m_run_room_trig 48145

triggers.name: shaman_speak3
triggers.commands: wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Vulcera is some kind of fiery demigoddess.  She appeared many years ago and took the volcano as her new palace.' wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Vulcera enslaved the dwarrow, the gnome-dwarves of the Mountain Tribe who live inside the volcano itself, and forced them to build her an ivory tower.' wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'She quickly laid claim to the rest of the island as her dominion.  Vulcera claimed she was the new volcano god demanded all sacrifices be made to her.  She slaughters anyone who displeases or disobeys along with their whole family.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'But the true god grows angry.  Without our sacrifices, he will surely destroy the entire island.  The people of the Ocean Tribe turned to cannibal rituals to protect themselves.  We of the Jungle Tribe wish Vulcera removed but are not strong enough to destroy a demigoddess.'

triggers.name: Fiery_Island_Quest_Grant_rewards
triggers.commands: wait 1 set person %self.people% while %person% if %person.quest_variable[fieryisle_quest:reward]% == yes && !%person.has_completed[fieryisle_quest]% wsend %person% You notice special glittering gems amongst the chamber's crystals! * * Set X to the level of the award - code does not run without it * Fiery Island, X = 55 if %person.level% < 55 set expcap %person.level% else set expcap 55 endif set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 8) * 125) elseif %expcap% < 25 eval expmod 1440 + ((%expcap% - 16) * 175) elseif %expcap% < 34 eval expmod 2840 + ((%expcap% - 24) * 225) elseif %expcap% < 49 eval expmod 4640 + ((%expcap% - 32) * 250) elseif %expcap% < 90 eval expmod 8640 + ((%expcap% - 48) * 300) else eval expmod 20940 + ((%expcap% - 89) * 600) endif * * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount * switch %person.class% case Warrior case Berserker * * 110% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 10)) break case Paladin case Anti-Paladin case Ranger * * 115% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 15)) break case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * * 120% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer case Monk * * 130% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% * 2) / 5) break default set expmod %expmod% done wsend %person% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 10 * * Xexp must be replaced by mexp, oexp, or wexp for this code to work * Pick depending on what is running the trigger * Fiery Island, xexp = wexp wexp %person% %setexp% eval loop %loop% + 1 done set gem 0 while %gem% < 3 eval drop %random.11% + 55736 wload obj %drop% eval gem %gem% + 1 done wforce %person% get all.gem quest complete fieryisle_quest %person.name% endif set person %person.next_in_room% done

triggers.name: fieryisle_quest_status_checker
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[fieryisle_quest]% wait 2 if %actor.level% < 55 say You aren't ready to take on the volcano goddess yet. halt endif if %actor.has_completed[fieryisle_quest]% mecho %self.name% says, 'You have freed us from Vulcera's tyranny!  The true mecho &0volcano god is pleased!' elseif %stage% > 0 say Currently you are trying to: switch %stage% case 1 mecho Enter the volcano and find the warlord's son. mecho Defeat the guardian to learn the mystic phrase to open the volcano. break case 2 mecho Find the dwarrow woman and ask for a spell of reversal. break case 3 mecho Kill the ash lord and retrieve his crown. break case 4 mecho Return the crown of the ash lord to the dwarrow woman. break case 5 mecho Find the person turned to rock and hold the spell the dwarrow woman gave you. break case 6 mecho Retrieve the ivory key. break case 7 mecho Find Vulcera in the ivory tower. break case 8 mecho Give the ivory key to Vulcera. break case 9 mecho Defeat Vulcera! break done if %stage% > 1 mecho The mystic phrase to open the volcano is &7&bbuntoi nakkarri karisto&0. endif else say You are not on this quest yet. endif

triggers.name: Jemnon Load Trigger

triggers.name: jemnon_greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Aaaaaaaaand who - ' wait 4 emote hiccups. wait 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, '- are you?' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You 'ere to 'ear the tales o' Jemnon the Lionhearted?!' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yeah?' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yeah??' nudge %actor% endif

triggers.name: jemnon_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 4 if %speech% == yes msend %actor% Very inebriated, %self.name% says, 'Then you come t' the right place!  Pull up a chair an' siddown!' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Now, whaddya wan' kno 'bout??' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Well I dun wanna talk t' yous anyway!' Emote crosses his arms in a huff and turns away. endif

triggers.name: jemnon_speak2
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Itsss made outta rocks!  So much rocks!  A rack MONSTER!' wait 1s emote looks confused. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Nuuuuuhhh a ROOK mahnster!' wait 1s shake wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Uuuuhhhhhh ROCK monster!  Yeah, a rock monster.  Terrible place I saw it.' endif

triggers.name: jemnon_speak3
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 1 quest advance meteorswarm %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Ooohhhhh you wann kno wheeeeere itis?!' msend %actor% %self.name% angrily shouts, 'You outta jus' say so!!' wait 2s emote blinks drunkenly. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Wat wuz I sayin'?' wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh yeah, the ROOK MONSTER.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Itz in a hole.' wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yep.  Great big hole.' wait 2s emote becomes deathly still. wait 6s msend %actor% In a suddenly clear voice, %self.name% speaks.  'I remember the smoke and ruins of the city. A fountain of blood gushed up from the town square.  I avoided the demons as best I could, but by accident I stumbled into a collapsed house at the end of a road...' wait 2 shiver wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'That's where I saw it, in a cave under the rubble...' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I wish I could forget...' cry wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Please, let me forget...' emote quickly downs another drink. wait 4s sleep wait 20s wake emote looks around very confused. endif

(%damdone%) wsend %actor% You seem to hear a voice whisper, 'This room is not for you.' return 0 endif endif endif

triggers.commands: set line %random.10% if %line% == 1 say You are a fool! elseif %line% == 2 say Do you really think you can match my power?! elseif %line% == 3 say It would have been wise to try to learn from me. say ...But now you must die! endif set heat !HEAT if %actor.eff_flags% /= %heat% || %actor.eff_flagged[sanct]% if %random.2% == 2 say Your magic is powerful, but not powerful enough to stop this force! endif c 'meteorswarm' %actor% elseif %actor.eff_flagged[stone]% c 'dispel mag' %actor% elseif %actor.eff_flagged[coldshield]% c 'melt' %actor% elseif %actor.eff_flagged[fireshield]% c 'immolate' %actor% else switch %random.3% case 1 c 'fireball' %actor% case 2 c 'acid burst' %actor% default c 'positive field' %actor% done endif wait 2s

triggers.name: mccabe greet
triggers.commands: ***McCabe's greet Trigger*** *** set stage %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% wait 1s ***No one should be here but sorcs and pyros, so lets throw the rest back out*** if %actor.class% != sorcerer && %actor.class% != pyromancer && %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% < %wandstep% con %actor% wait 2s say What are you doing here?! Get out! wait 1s mechoaround %actor% &4&b%self.name% &0&6 sends a blast of air at &9&b%actor.name%&6 sending %actor.o%&b tumbling!&0 msend %actor% &4&b%self.name% &0&6 sends a blast of air at &1&bYOU&6 sending you&b tumbling!&0 mteleport %actor% 48254 mforce %actor% look msend %actor% &4&b%self.name%'s &0&6blast of air sends you&b tumbling!&0 mteleport %actor% 48253 mforce %actor% look msend %actor% &4&b%self.name%'s &0&6blast of air sends you&b tumbling!&0 mteleport %actor% 48252 mforce %actor% look msend %actor% &4&b%self.name%'s &0&6blast of air comes at you from a new angle, sending you&b tumbling!&0 mteleport %actor% 48251 eval damage (%actor.level% * 2) + %random.30% mdamage %actor% %damage% fire msend %actor% &1&bYou sustain &0&1severe burns&b as you plunge head first through drizzling &0&1lava.&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) mforce %actor% look elseif (%actor.class% /= sorcerer && %actor.level% > 72) || (%actor.class% /= pyromancer && %actor.level% > 80) || %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if (%actor.class% /= sorcerer && %actor.level% > 72) || (%actor.class% /= pyromancer && %actor.level% > 80) if %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= no msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Do you have the new meteorite?' elseif !%stage% mload mob 48251 peer seagull emote focuses closely on the seagull flying overhead. mecho %self.name% starts casting '&3&bmeteorswarm&0' at an unsuspecting seagull. wait 1s m_run_room_trig 48257 mforce seagull panic mforce seagull emote panics and flees to the north. mpurge seagull wait 2s giggle wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I see you admire my conjuring.  Perhaps you've never seen anyone calling &6&bmeteors&0?' elseif %stage% == 1 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Have you spoken to Jemnon?  He's in some tavern, no doubt, waiting for some new blunder to embark on.' elseif %stage% == 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Well, did Jemnon tell you where the rock demon is?' elseif %stage% == 3 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Have you found a suitable focus?' elseif %stage% == 4 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I can see from the singe marks you accomplished your task!  Are you ready to press on?' elseif %stage% == 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Were you able to glean something from Dargentan's teachings?' endif if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Or is there even MORE you want from me?  You seem to be in need of a crafting &6&b[upgrade]&0.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need for the %weapon%?' endif endif endif else if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Do you have what I need for the %weapon%?' endif endif endif endif
