triggers.name: mccabe dialog
triggers.argument_list: meteor meteors meteors? meteorswarm yes no
triggers.commands: ***McCabes Speech Trigger*** *This trigger represents the launching point, ending point, and intersection of the 3 parts of the meteor quest. *stage 1 deals with finding Jemnon *stage 2 is getting a mastery of earth, and ends back here. *stage 3 sends the quester off to the fire temple high priest, and ends back here. *stage 4 sends the quester to dargentans lair to master air, which then ends back here. *stage 5 means the player has mastered all 3 elements, combined them into an item, and can now cast a meteorswarm with that item. *the quest is actually completed by the item itself, when the player casts its one and only charge of meteorswarm. set stage %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% wait 1s if (%actor.class% /= sorcerer || %actor.class% /= pyromancer) && %actor.level% > 72 if !%stage% && (%speech% /= meteor || %speech% /= meteors || %speech% /= meteors? || %speech% /= no) msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes, they are the culmination of my life's work.  They are the perfect balance of earth, fire, and air.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Now leave me to my fun.  I have a seagull to obliterate.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'If you like, you may stand by and observe.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% starts casting '&3&bcelneptin&0'... wait 2s m_run_room_trig 48257 wait 3s sigh msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I suppose you wish to do more than observe, am I right?  %actor.name%, would you like to try to learn this rather difficult spell?' elseif %speech% /= yes if %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= no say Show me the meteorite. elseif !%stage% quest start meteorswarm %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes, well first you need a powerful piece of earth.  Not just any rock will do.  It needs to be positively alive with great energy.' wait 2s consider %actor% wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I doubt that you would be able to summon such earth yourself...  At least, not until you have mastered the element.' wait 5s ponder wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'There was once a powerful mage that created a massive guardian of stone to bar the way into the Nine Hells.  Such a creature would be a perfect source of powerfully imbued earth.' dream wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Unfortunately, I do not know where the location of that entry is.  But I know someone who might.' wait 1s grumble wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'There's a drunken lout, goes by the name Jemnon the Lionhearted.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'His exploits are as idiotic as the greatest heroes are brave.  While he causes far more problems than he solves, he has stumbled upon more secret knowledge than I care to admit.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'He may very well know the location of this rocky behemoth.' wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Your first challenge will be &6&blocating Jemnon&0.  He's almost certainly drinking himself stupid in a &6&bbar&0 or &6&btavern&0 somewhere.  If you do find him, you'll have to &6&bask him about the rock monster&0.' switch %random.13% case 1 * Tavern of the Fallen Star in Southern Borderhold set bar_num 2334 break case 2 * Sloshed Squirrel in Mielikki set bar_num 3033 break case 3 * Forest Tavern in Mielikki set bar_num 3053 break case 4 * Ole Witch Tavern in Anduin set bar_num 6037 break case 5 * Phillips Backdoor Bar in Anduin set bar_num 6044 break case 6 * Red Feathered Nest Anduin set bar_num 6054 break case 7 * Shawns Tavern in Anduin set bar_num 6112 break case 8 * Drunken Ogre Inn in Anduin set bar_num 6131 break case 9 * Golden Goblet Inn and Tavern in Anduin set bar_num 6226 break case 10 * Karrs Pub in Ickle set bar_num 10029 break case 11 * Mermaid's Tail in Ogakh set bar_num 30008 break case 12 * Biergarten in Ogakh set bar_num 30089 break default *Flirting Puppy set bar_vnum 51045 done quest variable meteorswarm %actor.name% bar_num %bar_num% wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You can check on your &6&b[spell progress]&0 with me at any time.' elseif %stage% == 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Magnificent!  Bring back a piece of it as a magical focus and I can continue teaching you this spell.' elseif %stage% == 3 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Splendid!  May I see it?' wait 2s elseif %stage% == 4 quest variable meteorswarm %actor% fire 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The last element you must master is the sky itself.  But this must be no mere demonstration of the power of flight, or even a large gust of wind.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'No, in order to understand the sheer magnitude of energy involved, you will need to learn from a true master of air.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'But who would be most appropriate...?' think wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Wait, I've got it!  It's a long shot...' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'But...' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You should &6&bmeet with the dragon who created the floating fortress in southern Caelia&0.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Ask him to teach you.  And be certain to show him the proper respect when you do!' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Good luck!  You'll need it...' elseif %stage% == 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Let me check the meteorite.' endif endif endif

triggers.name: meteor splash
triggers.commands: wecho McCabe completes his spell... wecho McCabe closes his eyes and utters the words, 'meteorswarm' wecho &1McCabe conjures up a controlled shower of meteors &9&bwhich &4splash &0&6harmlessly down in the ocean.&0 wat 48252 wecho &1A swarm of burning &9&bmeteors stream down from the sky, &4&bsplashing &0&6harmlessly into the ocean.&0 wat 48253 wecho &1A swarm of burning &9&bmeteors stream down from the sky, &4&bsplashing &0&6harmlessly into the ocean.&0 wat 48254 wecho &1A swarm of burning &9&bmeteors stream down from the sky, &4&bsplashing &0&6harmlessly into the ocean.&0

triggers.name: mccabe_receive
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% set earth %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:earth]% set air %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:air]% if %object.vnum% == 48251 return 0 shake wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go &6&buse&0 this new treasure; don't give it back to me!' elseif %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= no return 0 mecho %self.name% accepts the meteorite. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Good, this will work.' mecho %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc%. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go, resume your studies.' quest variable meteorswarm %actor% new 0 else switch %stage% case 1 return 0 eye wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'No, go find Jemnon first.' break case 2 return 0 eye wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'No, go find the rock demon first.' break case 3 if %earth% == 0 return 0 msend %actor% You give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Such wonderfully powerful stone.  This will do perfectly.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Next, you need to demonstrate mastery over fire.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The northern cult of fire provides an excellent opportunity to do so.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Take the meteor, &6&bslay the high priest, and find the secret lava well&0.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The charge from such energy will be ideal for conjuring.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% returns %object.shortdesc% to you. quest variable meteorswarm %actor.name% earth 1 else return 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes yes, you have already proven it's a lovely focus.' endif break case 4 return 0 eye wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'No, go find Dargentan first.' break case 5 if %air% == 0 mjunk meteorite wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'This meteorite, representing the force of earth, has been imbued with the spirits of fire and air.  It will serve as the perfect focus for casting meteorswarm.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You are ready.' wait 3s mload obj 48251 give meteorite %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go somewhere safe, and &6&buse it&0 to unlock its potential.' quest variable meteorswarm %actor.name% air 1 else return 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Where did you find a second one of these?  You don't need it.' endif break default return 0 wait 1s eye msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'And what exactly am I supposed to do with this?' done endif

triggers.name: fire_priest_death
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 3 quest variable meteorswarm %person.name% fire 1 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 3 quest variable meteorswarm %person.name% fire 1 endif

triggers.name: dargentan_meteorswarm_quest_speak1
triggers.argument_list: teach help meteor meteorswarm meteorite air
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 4 if %actor.align% > -349 nod msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The depths of thy training doth shine through.  I shalt teach thee for thou art stout and bold.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% raises up, wings spread. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% begins to cast... wait 3s msend %actor% The sky swirls around the lair as all the crystals begin to hum and glow. msend %actor% You hear the music of the sky sing in your ears. wait 1s msend %actor% &7&bThe meteorite begins to hum in tune.&0 wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Dost thine ears perceive thus?  Tis the music of the spheres!  Remember it upon thy conjuring!' msend %actor% &7&bYou feel your mastery of the air growing!&0 quest advance meteorswarm %actor.name% wait 5s say Alloweth this one to return thus to rest anon. wait 2 sleep else say I shall help thee... TO SOAR 'MONGST THE BIRDS!! wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% grabs you in his mighty claws and throws you bodily from the tower! mechoaround %actor% %self.name% grabs %actor.name% in his mighty claws and throws %actor.himher% bodily from the tower! mforce %actor% sit mteleport %actor% 23893 wait 8s t %actor% I doth desire thee didst enjoy thy lesson! wait 1s msend %actor% &7&bThe meteorite begins to hum! msend %actor% Strangely enough, you do feel you have learned something significant about the power of the air.&0 quest advance meteorswarm %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: jemnon_exit
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 2 mecho %self.name% wanders off. mpurge %self% endif

triggers.name: meteorswarm_dargentan_bow
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= dargentan || %arg% /= dar || %arg% /= huge || %arg% /= large || %arg% /= dragon || %arg% /= sleeping || %arg% /= peaceful msend %actor% You bow before him. mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% bows before Dargentan. if %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% == 4 wait 2 glare msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Wherefore hast thou awakened one such as this from deepest slumber?' endif else return 0 endif

triggers.name: meteorswarm_new_meteorite_replacement
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% > 2 && !%actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:air]% wait 2 gasp msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'WHAT?!' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'How could you be so careless??'' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have no choice, you have to get a new meteorite.' quest variable meteorswarm %actor% new yes wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You already know where the rock demon is.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Good luck.' endif

triggers.name: meteorswarm_status_checker
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[meteorswarm]% wait 2 if %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= yes msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Go find a new meteorite.' halt elseif %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:new]% /= no msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Show me the meteorite again.'' halt endif switch %stage% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You need to find Jemnon and &6&bask about the rock demon&0.  He's in some &6&btavern&0, no doubt, waiting for some new blunder to embark on.' break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Find a suitable focus by defeating the rock demon in Templace.' break case 3 if %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:earth]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Show me the meteorite.' else if %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:fire]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Find and kill the high fire priest in the Lava Tunnels.  Then enter the lava bubble below his secret chambers.' else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Find the lava bubble in the high fire priest's secret chambers.' endif endif wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'If you somehow lost the meteorite, say &1&b"I lost the meteorite"&0.' break case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Convince the ancient dragon Dargentan to teach you the ways of air magic.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'If you somehow lost the meteorite, say &1&b"I lost the meteorite"&0.' break case 5 if %actor.quest_variable[meteorswarm:air]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Show me the meteorite now that you have mastered earth, fire, and air.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'If you somehow lost the meteorite, say &1&b"I lost the meteorite"&0.' else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Take your finished focus and unleash its potential!' endif done

rooms.name: Mouth of the Lagoon
rooms.description: You have entered a body of water which is sheltered from the salty sea by a ridge of coral.  The lagoon is very calm and as you peer into the water, you are surprised to discover that you can see the sandy bottom.  A multitude of gaily colored fish swim underneath you, blissfully unaware of your presence. Suddenly hungry, you plunge your hand into the warm water in an attempt to snare a particularly fat fish which easily evades your clumsy grab. Disappointed, you raise your eyes to the island looming before you, and in particular to the volcano which dominates and birthed this island.  The sight of the volcano fills you with awe...  And fear.  Although its green slopes attest to its dormancy, it possesses an abeyant energy which hints at explosive power.  To the west and east the island juts out to the sea in two points thick with jungle trees.  You don't think you could force your way through the tangle of trees, even if you wanted to.  To the south, you see the great expanse of the ocean.  The lagoon continues to the north.

rooms.name: The Lagoon
rooms.description: The lagoon below you is clear and still.  You peer into the water and note the wonderful variety of life this lagoon harbors.  To the west an impassable tangle of jungle trees crowds closely to the shore, but the lagoon continues to the north, east and south.

rooms.name: The Lagoon
rooms.description: The lagoon below you is clear and still.  You peer into the water and note the wonderful variety of life this lagoon harbors.  To the east and south an impassable tangle of jungle trees crowds closely to the shore, but the lagoon continues to the west and north.

rooms.name: The Lagoon
rooms.description: The lagoon below you is clear and still.  You peer into the water and note the wonderful variety of life this lagoon harbors.  To the north and east an impassable tangle of jungle trees crowds closely to the shore, but the lagoon continues to the west and south.

rooms.name: The Lagoon
rooms.description: The lagoon below you is clear and still.  You peer into the water and note the wonderful variety of life this lagoon harbors.  To the west an impassable tangle of jungle trees crowds closely to shore, but the lagoon continues to the north, east, and south.

rooms.name: The Lagoon
rooms.description: The lagoon below you is clear and still.  You peer into the water and note the wonderful variety of life this lagoon harbors.  To the west and east an impassable tangle of jungle trees crowds closely to the shore.  The lagoon continues to the south and you spot a sandy beach to the north.

rooms.name: The Sandy Beach
rooms.description: You step onto the rough sand of this beach and stare for some time at the peaceful lagoon.  Despite the heat and humidity of this island, you feel this would be a very pleasant place to live.  The smell of the jungle is strong here and you absorb the exotic aromas as you rest.  To the east you spot a faint track leading into the jungle depths.  The track could be an animal trail... Or it could be man-made.  Passage to the west and north is blocked by a thick growth of jungle trees.  The lagoon stretches before you to the south.

rooms.name: The Jungle Trail
rooms.description: The trail winds madly through the jungle, at times going north, then east, then south.  After a time, however, it straightens out and runs in a generally east-west direction.  At one point it curves suddenly to the north; you may either continue along the trail to the north, or follow the trail west, back to the sandy beach.  The way to the east and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Jungle Trail
rooms.description: As you follow this trail you delight in the exotic sounds produced deep within the jungle.  The calls from the unseen birds produce a sort of music, and you allow yourself to relax as you listen to the beautiful sonance.  The trail continues to the east and south.  Passage to the west and north is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Jungle Trail
rooms.description: As you walk along the trail a peculiar rock lying along the way draws your attention.  Curious, you pick the stone up and find that it is not a plain rock, but a piece of obsidian that has been fashioned into a spearhead. Disturbed, you turn the spearhead nervously in your hand as you scan the jungle for signs of danger.  You become determined to be more wary of this strange new land.  You let the obsidian drop from your hand, allowing it to serve as a warning to future visitors that this island harbors humanoids who are no strangers to violence, and who may be hostile.  The trail continues to the west and east.  Passage to the north and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Jungle Trail
rooms.description: As you tread this trail a new sound blends with the familiar calls of the jungle birds.  You fail to identify the sound at first, but you gradually recognize the faint cadence of a humanoid tongue.  The jungle seems to play tricks with noises, for you cannot identify the direction from which the sound issues.  The trail splits at this point; you may follow it either to the north, west, or east.  Passage to the south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Jungle Tribe Village
rooms.description: You have entered a clearing that is ringed on three sides by well-maintained huts.  In the center of the clearing is a large fire pit lined with basalt rocks.  Around the pit several logs are arranged in a roughly spherical pattern; you can easily imagine a group of tribes folk sitting on these logs, eating dinner.  You wonder what it is they eat, and hope they do not count human flesh among their delicacies.  You may enter either of the three huts, or return to the jungle trail, which is to the west.

rooms.name: The Family Hut
rooms.description: This is the largest hut in the village.  It is here that the wives and children sleep.  The floor of the hut is covered with leaves and grasses.  The walls are adorned with beautiful corals fashioned into various shapes and sizes.  The exit is to the south.

rooms.name: The Warrior's Hut
rooms.description: This small hut serves as sleeping quarters for the Jungle Tribe's warriors. A few broken pieces of coral lie scattered across the floor, which is layered with leaves and grasses.  The exit is to the west.

rooms.name: The Warchief's Hut
rooms.description: The leader of this village lives alone in a small hut.  You would expect the leader to posses the wealth of the village, but it seems the only possession the chief holds that the others lack is the luxury of privacy, for his quarters are barren.  You wonder why villagers living on an island as seemingly rich as this one would be so poor in material goods.  The exit is to the north.

rooms.name: The Jungle Path
rooms.description: This path seems less used than the jungle trail which originated at the sandy beach.  It seems less people travel this route.  You wonder what dangers lay ahead.  The path continues to the north and south.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.  A heavily engraved totem pole stands here.

extras.text: This totem pole seems to be a warning of some sort. There are a number of images engraved upon its surface but the predominant image features a three-headed monster.

rooms.name: The Jungle Path
rooms.description: This path seems less used than the jungle trail which originated at the sandy beach.  It seems less people travel this route.  You wonder what dangers lay ahead.  The path continues to the north and south.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Jungle Path
rooms.description: You have come to a T-intersection in the jungle path.  Passage to the north is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees, but you are free to travel along this path in either the south, west or east directions.  The path to the east is badly overgrown.

rooms.name: The Jungle Path
rooms.description: This path has not been used in some time.  In places the path is almost completely overgrown.  At one point, it disappears completely.  You spend several minutes searching for the path before finally finding a faint trace. You may continue along this path to the west, or follow the path eastward in the hope that it leads to something of interest before it disappears for good. Passage to the north and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Jungle Path
rooms.description: At this point, the path becomes fragmented and completely unreliable.  You believe the path continues to the east, but this could be a false trail created by an animal.  Passage to the north and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.  You may also follow the path west back to the T-intersection.

rooms.name: End of the Jungle Path
rooms.description: You follow the path for as long as you can, but it eventually becomes so fragmented and uncertain that you can follow it no longer.  Passage to the north, east and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees; your only retreat is to the west.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: The unrelenting heat and humidity of this island finally begins to take a toll on your fitness as you make your way along this path.  You glance at the volcano and note that you are much closer to it now then when you arrived at this isle.  The path continues to the west and east.  Passage to the north and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: The unrelenting heat and humidity of this island finally begin to take a toll on your fitness as you make your way along this path.  You glance at the volcano and note that you are much closer to it than when you arrived at this isle.  The path continues to the west and east.  Passage to the north and south is blocked a thick growth of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: The unrelenting heat and humidity of this island finally begin to take a toll on your fitness as you make your way along this path.  You glance at the volcano and note you are much closer to it than when you arrived at this isle. The path continues to the south and east.  Passage to the north and west is blocked by a thick growth of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: The unrelenting heat and humidity of this island finally begin to take a toll on your fitness as you make your way along this path.  You glance at the volcano and note you are much closer to it that when you arrived at this isle. The path continues to the north and west.  Passage to the east is blocked by a thick growth of jungle trees.  You think you see a small clearing to the south.

rooms.name: Before a Hut
rooms.description: You have entered a small clearing in the jungle.  The clearing was created by man with axe and fire, but it is obvious the area has not been maintained in some time.  South of you, in the center of the clearing, you see a ramshackle thatch hut.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.  The path is to the north.

rooms.name: Inside the Old Shaman's Hut
rooms.description: This hut is cramped and shows signs of frequent use.  A small hole in the thatch roof provides ventilation for an indoor fire pit.  The corners of the room are heavily layered with dust but the center of the room has been brushed free due to frequent use.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: Wiping the sweat from your brow, you trudge along this path and wonder what secrets, if any, this path will lead you to.  The path continues to the west and east.  Passage to the south and north is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: The oppressive heat erodes your concentration; at times, you find your mind wandering, and you silently chastise yourself for these lapses.  From deep within the jungle you hear a horrible noise as a large animal crashes through the underbrush.  Reminding yourself that this island holds unknown dangers, you become determined to focus upon your surroundings and resist the dreamy lure of the heat.  The path continues to the north and east.  Passage south and west is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: As you travel this path you get the oddest feeling that you are being watched.  Suddenly wary, you listen intently to the jungle, alert for the sound of a cracking twig or any other sign which may hint at an unseen watcher or follower.  However, you cannot distinguish any sound above the incessant noises of the jungle birds.  You curse the music which you once found so delightful, and vow to kill any bird you cross, but catch only faint, colorful glimpses of the jungle fauna.  Unseen eyes probe you as you decide whether to continue along the trail to the west or south.  Passage to the north and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: As you travel this path you get the oddest feeling that you are being watched.  Suddenly wary, you listen intently to the jungle, alert for the sound of a cracking twig or any other sign which may hint at an unseen watcher or follower.  However, you cannot distinguish any sound above the incessant noises of the jungle birds.  You curse the music which you once found so delightful, and vow to kill any bird you cross, but catch only faint, colorful glimpses of the jungle fauna.  Unseen eyes probe you as you decide whether to continue along the trail to the north, west, or east.  Passage to the south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.description: As you travel this path you get the oddest feeling that you are being watched.  Suddenly wary, you listen intently to the jungle, alert for the sound of a cracking twig or any other sign which may hint at an unseen watcher or follower.  However, you cannot distinguish any sound above the incessant noises of the jungle birds.  You curse the music which you once found so delightful, and vow to kill any bird you cross, but catch only faint, colorful glimpses of the jungle fauna.  Unseen eyes probe you as you decide whether to continue along the trail to the west or east.  Passage to the north and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

Suddenly wary, you listen intently to the jungle, alert for the sound of a cracking twig or any other sign which may hint at an unseen watcher or follower.  However, you cannot distinguish any sound above the incessant noises of the jungle birds.  You curse the music which you once found so delightful, and vow to kill any bird you cross, but catch only faint, colorful glimpses of the jungle fauna.  Unseen eyes probe you as you decide whether to continue along the trail to the south or east.  Passage to the north and west is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Bone Tribe Camp
rooms.description: As you enter this clearing your eyes are immediately drawn to a totem pole from which hang a dozen skulls, the cause of the name of the tribe.  Some of the skulls are human but there are others you fail to recognize.  The totem pole faces to the north and you understand that the natives believe it gives them supernatural protection the monsters which periodically issue forth from the volcano to raid their territory.  To the south you see a small hut.  There is a trail to the north, and passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

extras.text: You look at the totem pole and wonder if one day your own skull will decorate it...

rooms.name: The Bone Tribe Chieftain's Hut
rooms.description: It is apparent as you enter this hut that the chief of the Bone Tribe is also their spiritual leader.  Small wooden dolls, crudely carved to resemble men, beasts, and birds, lie scattered about the floor.  You know the dolls serve a quasi-religious purpose.  To the north you see the camp.

extras.text: The dolls are of poor quality and are not worth taking.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: This path is narrow and has been lightly traveled.  It runs in a north-south direction.  The path north aims directly at the heart of the volcano.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: Deep Jungle Path
rooms.description: This path is narrow and has been lightly traveled.  The jungle trees are not as abundant here as to the south but they are still thick enough to the east and north to block your passage.  The trail continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: Black Rock Clearing
rooms.description: The path leads straight to a shattered slab of black rock.  Aside from the few stunted shoots that grow in the stone's fractures, this area is devoid of life.  Even the jungle noises are less pronounced here.  A huge wooden pole stands in the center of the stone, its surface blackened with fire.  The pole projects cleanly through the stone.  An air of sadness and loss hangs over this clearing.  There is a path to the east, and passage to the north and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.  A thin trail, so faint it is visible only to an experienced eye such as yours, snakes through the jungle to the west.

extras.text: Sacrifices to the great beast which terrorizes the islanders are bound here. The pole is blackened with fire and crusty with old blood.

rooms.name: The Hidden Path
rooms.description: You examine this trail carefully as you walk it.  The path has been used recently, as evidenced by the freshly crushed shoots and leaves.  The trail is very faint, and your woodlore is heavily taxed to keep you true to the path. The path continues to the north, and to the east you see the black rock clearing.  Passage to the west and south is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Hidden Path
rooms.description: The path becomes more rugged to the north.  You shiver uncomfortably as you peer northward, for you see this path leads straight to the volcano.  You may travel upslope to the north, or flee back down the mountain by going south. Passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Hidden Path
rooms.description: You curse your luck as you trip over an unseen stone.  You rise, and brushing yourself off, spot a strange mark in the exposed soil near the offending stone.  Examining the mark more closely, you find it is a goat track, though the hooves of this goat seem unusually large.  The path continues to the east and south.  Passage to the west and north is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Hidden Path
rooms.description: The path is steep here and you must travel slowly to avoid a nasty fall down the slope.  Looking south, you see you are some distance above the canopy of jungle trees.  The path continues to the north and west.  Passage to the south and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Hidden Path
rooms.description: The path is steep here and you must travel slowly to prevent a nasty fall down the slope.  Looking south, you see you are some distance above the canopy of jungle trees.  The path continues to the north and south.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by a thick tangle of jungle trees.

rooms.name: The Hidden Path
rooms.description: The path is steep here and you must travel slowly to prevent a nasty fall down the slope.  Looking south, you see you are some distance above the canopy of jungle trees.  The path continues to the north and south.  Passage to the west and east is made impassable by the jungle flora and the rugged terrain.

rooms.name: Before the Cave
rooms.description: Before you looms a huge cave leading into the volcano.  The cave's entrance is large and dark and resembles the mouth of some horrible beast from your nightmares.  A foul wind blows from the cave; it is warm and bears the stench of a wild animal.  You may venture into the volcano by traveling north into the cave, or you may flee in terror from this dreadful place by careening downslope via the path to the south.  Passage to the west and east is blocked by the jungle flora and the rugged terrain.

rooms.name: Mouth of the Volcano
rooms.description: This cave is large and is obviously the lair of some foul beast.  Bones litter the floor and you note with a sense of revulsion that many of these bones appear to be human.  A crude nest made of leaves and twigs is pushed up against the far wall.  Near the nest, the gory remains of a half-eaten humanoid serve as warning to your fate should your attempt to slay the chimera prove futile.  A trail seems to lead north right up to the side of the volcano.

rooms.name: Beginning of the Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: You have entered a tunnel which runs to the north and south.  A foul odor wafts from the chimera's cave to the south; shuddering with the memory of that fearsome beast, you realize that the chimera may not be the most loathsome monster you will have to fight today.  The floor of this tunnel is covered with a fine layer of soot.  The layer of soot appears to be thickest to the north.

rooms.name: The Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: Studying the walls of this tunnel, you realize this passageway was made by no natural force; these tunnels were hewn out of rock, fashioned by stonewise and intelligent beings.  The ash is thicker here than to the south and becomes noticeably denser to the east.  You may continue along the tunnel by following it as it curves to the east, or head south back toward the chimera's cave.

rooms.name: The Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: Studying the walls of this tunnel, you realize that this passageway was not made by a natural force; these tunnels were hewn out of rock, fashioned by stonewise and intelligent beings.  The floor of this tunnel is covered with a thick ash; the ash is thickest along the sides of the tunnel, rising up above your kneecaps.  A furrow in the ash runs through the center of the tunnel. This furrow was created by the passage of many creatures; the small, delicate footprints of these humanoids are clearly visible in the ash.  As you stand ankle-deep in the center of the ash passageway, you see you may follow the tunnel to either the west or east.

rooms.name: Lair of the Ash Lord
rooms.description: No furrow or tracks mar the thick layer of ash which carpets this chamber. As you make your way to the center of this cavernous room, you choke on the ash which is disturbed by your passing and rises, mist-like, into the air. Blinking to clear your burning eyes, you scan the chamber for hints of danger, while holding your weapon ready.

rooms.name: The Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: Studying the walls of this tunnel, you realize that this passageway was not made by a natural force; these tunnels were hewn out of rock, fashioned by stonewise and intelligent beings. This furrow was created by the passage of many creatures; the small, delicate footprints of these humanoids are clearly visible in the ash.  As you stand ankle-deep in the center of the ash passageway, you see you may follow the tunnel to either the north or south.  There is a chamber to the east.

rooms.name: The Worker's Den
rooms.description: You have discovered the sleeping quarters of the pitiful creatures which are forced to burrow tunnels through the mighty volcano.  The room is cramped, and lacks furnishings or decorations of any kind.  In view of the fact that the Mountain Tribe are slaves, and poorly treated at that, you find it curious that there are no guards to oversee their work, no guards to insure they do not run away or rebel.  You find yourself wondering what prevents the dwarrow from leaving.  Perhaps there is more here than meets the eye.  There is a vent of warm air on the east wall large enough to enter.  The air coming from the vent is very warm.  You may enter the heat vent to the east, or return to the ash tunnel west.

rooms.name: The Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: Studying the walls of this tunnel, you realize that this passageway was not made by a natural force; these tunnels were hewn out of rock, fashioned by stonewise and intelligent beings.  The floor of this tunnel is covered with a thick ash; the ash is thickest along the sides of the tunnel, rising up above your kneecaps.  A furrow in the ash runs through the center of the tunnel. This furrow was created by the passage of many creatures; the small, delicate footprints of these humanoids are clearly visible in the ash.  As you stand ankle-deep in the center of the ash passageway, you see you may follow the tunnel to either the south or west.

As you stand ankle-deep in the center of the ash passageway, you see you may follow the tunnel to either the west or east.

rooms.description: Studying the walls of this tunnel, you realize that this passageway was not made by a natural force; these tunnels were hewn out of rock, fashioned by stonewise and intelligent beings.  The floor of this tunnel is covered with a thick ash; the ash is thickest along the sides of the tunnel, rising up above your kneecaps.  A furrow in the ash runs through the center of the tunnel. This furrow was created by the passage of many creatures; the small, delicate footprints of these humanoids are clearly visible in the ash.  As you stand ankle-deep in the center of the ash passageway, you see that the tunnel continues to the east, and a chamber open to the south.

rooms.name: The Family Den
rooms.description: This small room is packed with a miserable lot of the Mountain Tribe dwarves.  Their large eyes stare at you pitifully as you enter the chamber. You note that although they are disturbed by your presence, they don't seem particularly afraid of you.  Perhaps they have lived under a cloud of fear and oppression for so long they have lost sensitivity to these emotions.  The expression on their faces is one of resignation, and you know that were you to draw your weapon and slay one of these dwarrows, she would take no action to defend herself.  You notice suddenly that the dwarrows in this chamber are either all female or are all children; perhaps this is how the tribe's loyalty is gained: by separating the men from the women, and holding the women as hostages for the men's good behavior.  The only visible exit is to the north, and leads back to the ash tunnel.

West.description: You see a panel, cleverly hidden within the stone.

rooms.name: An Escape Tunnel
rooms.description: Made for a dwarrow, the tunnel is cramped.  By necessity, the tunnel is little more than a crawlway near the family den, but widens out the further west it goes.  You may either follow the tunnel as it continues west, or you may exit the tunnel by returning east, back to the family den.

East.description: You see a panel, cleverly hidden within the stone.

rooms.name: An Escape Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel widens until you are finally able to stand without crouching. The tunnels ends abruptly to the west and continues to the east.  It seems this tunnel is a long way from being completed.

rooms.name: The Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: Studying the walls of this tunnel, you realize that this passageway was not made by a natural force; these tunnels were hewn out of rock, fashioned by stonewise and intelligent beings.  The floor of this tunnel is covered with a thick ash; the ash is thickest along the sides of the tunnel, rising up above your kneecaps.  A furrow in the ash runs through the center of the tunnel. This furrow was created by the passage of many creatures; the small, delicate footprints of these humanoids are clearly visible in the ash.  As you stand ankle-deep in the center of the ash passageway, you see you may follow the tunnel to either the west or east.

rooms.name: End of the Ash Tunnel
rooms.description: The ash becomes progressively thinner as you move west along this tunnel. To the east, you see the continuation of the ash tunnels.  To the south, the tunnel begins a rather steep decline.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. You notice that a mural has been painted onto the walls of this passageway. The mural continues on to the east without a break.  One end of the tunnel rises sharply to the north and proceeds toward the ash tunnel; the other end leads eastward.

extras.text: You examine the scenes of this artwork and note that in your immediate area it depicts a man with flaming red hair admiring a woman.  The man is pictured as possessing a fiery aura; perhaps he is a god.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. A mural running along one wall depicts a fire-god embracing a mortal woman. The tunnel continues to the west and east.  Another tunnel begins to the north. Contrasting sharply with the smooth tunnel, the tunnel to the north is rough-hewn and crude.

rooms.name: A Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the north and south.

rooms.name: A Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the west, east, and south.

rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the north, west, east and south.

rooms.name: A Dead End in the Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the east.

rooms.name: A Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: A Dead End in the Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the east.

rooms.name: A Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the west, east, and south.  To the east you perceive a great, heavy darkness which seems to swallow up your light.  Suddenly feeling small and defenseless, you take an involuntary step towards the west, away from the mysterious darkness.

rooms.name: A Dead End in the Rugged Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel seems much more rugged than any others you have seen in the volcano.  The floor of the tunnel is uneven, at times seeming to slope upward, at other times sloping down.  The walls of this tunnel are pitted and appear to have been blackened with fire.  The tunnel continues to the north.

rooms.name: At the Edge of the Darkness
rooms.description: As you approach the source of the darkness you see a great, gaping maw that seems to lead straight down to the very center of the earth.  You take a fragmented rock and toss it into the maw, listening closely for the sound of an impact, counting silently to judge the distance.  You stand at the lip of the pit for several minutes, but fail to hear an impact.  Shaking your head in wonder, you begin to turn from the edge when suddenly the rock beneath your feet crumbles!

rooms.name: Surrounded by Darkness
rooms.description: Here you are, surrounded by darkness, with nothing between you and the center of the earth but air. You feel sorry for yourself and begin to review your life. It is not a long life but you have plenty of time so you spend much time contemplating it. Resigned at your fate, you lace your hands behind your head, and, elbows sticking out like awkward wings, try to make yourself as comfortable as possible.

Resigned at your fate, you lace your hands behind your head, and, elbows sticking out like awkward wings, try to make yourself as comfortable as possible.

East.description: Upon close inspection you see a fissure in the rock.

Resigned at your fate, you lace your hands behind your head, and, elbows sticking out like awkward wings, try to make yourself as comfortable as possible.

rooms.name: Past the Fissure
rooms.description: This chamber is rocky and rough-hewn.  You are unable to detect the Mountain Tribe's handiwork here.  It seems this chamber was created by someone...  Or something...  Other than Vulcera's slaves.  The ceiling is low and you must duck your head as you enter the room.  Several large boulders are strewn randomly around the chamber.

West.description: You see a crack in the wall. It looks strange.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. A mural runs along one wall and the tunnel continues to the west and east.

extras.text: The mural shows a fire-god and a mortal woman exchanging vows of love and fidelity.  Your heart goes out to the couple, for you know that stories of gods and mortals falling in love always end in disaster.  An inscription written beneath the mural reads: The Love of Vulkaer, Lord of Earthfire, for his bride Zaira will remain true for all eternity.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. A mural adorns one wall of the tunnel which continues to the west and curves gracefully to the south.

extras.text: The now familiar mural continues the story of Vulkaer and his mortal love. Zaira, her hair damp with perspiration, is pictured holding aloft a newborn child for Vulkaer to view.  The god's face radiates pride as he views his daughter.  Beneath the infant is written a single phrase: Vulcera, born of Vulkaer and Zaira.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. The tunnel is painted on one wall and continues to the north and south.

extras.text: The mural continues to show the god and his wife as happily married and enjoying the company of their child.  However, looming in the background is a shadow.  You recognize the shadow as Lokari, the God of the Moonless Night.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. The tunnel is painted with a mural on one wall and continues to the north and south.

extras.text: The mural continues the story of Vulkaer and his mortal wife.  The two of them are pictured sleeping blissfully, while Lokari sneaks from their presence, carrying a bundled load under his arm.  A tiny hand peeks from underneath the bundle, and with a shock you realize that the evil god is kidnapping Vulkaer's daughter.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. The tunnel has a mural painted on one wall and continues to the north and south.

extras.text: As the mural continues the story, you realize that several years have passed since the last drawing.  The mural reveals Lokari raising the stolen child as his own, and in his own dark fashion.  One chilling scene shows Lokari and the child eating the flesh of a man.  The victim's fleshless body lies at their feet.  There is an inscription below the body.  It reads: It was through Lokari that Vulcera learned the evil nature of her heart.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. The tunnel has a mural on one wall and continues to the north and curves gracefully to the west.

extras.text: The mural shows Vulkaer tracking Lokari and finally expelling him from the mortal plane with fierce magiks.  One scene shows Vulcera weeping over the loss of the only father she has ever known while Vulkaer looks on, perplexed.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. This part of the tunnel is painted on one wall and continues to the west and east.

extras.text: This section of the tunnel documents the many horrors that Vulcera delighted in.  She learned these pleasures from her pseudo-father Lokari.  In the final scene of this mural, Vulcera and Zaira are shown in a bitter argument.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. You see a mural painted on the wall and the tunnel continues to the west and east.

extras.text: You find yourself looking at the largest mural you have seen in the tunnel. What is remarkable about the mural, however, is not its size but its detail and artism.  The mural's artwork is clearly superior to any other artwork you have ever seen-- perhaps it was done by a god.  The mural shows Vulcera slaying her mother and then feeding upon Zaira's organs.  There is an inscription along the top of the tunnel.  It reads: Know that on this day my heart died, for I lost two who I loved dearly-- my daughter to evil, my wife to an evil heart.

rooms.name: A Smooth Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls of this tunnel are as smooth as glass.  You can only admire the skill of the Mountain Tribe tunnel-makers as you pity them for their captivity. The tunnel has a mural painted on one wall and opens up before you to the north.

extras.text: The final mural in this sequence displays Vulkaer and Vulcera battling. Vulkaer defeats his daughter and, lacking the resolve to kill the daughter he once loved dearly, imprisons her in a mighty volcano, forbidding her to ever leave.

rooms.name: An unfinished room
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: An unfinished room
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: MOBILE_TRANSFER_ROOM
rooms.description: Hmm...  You shouldn't be in here!  Everything is formless void and you start to worry that you will be deconstructed too...

rooms.name: Along the Inner Rim of the Volcano
rooms.description: The tunnel before you opens up to reveal a cylinder in the center of the volcano.  This cylinder is so wide you cannot see the far side of it, so deep you cannot see the bottom.  A stone walkway begins at the end of the smooth tunnel and, slanting downward, winds along the inner rim of this cylinder. Stepping onto this walkway and peering into the depths, your light just barely illuminates the same stone walkway several dozen meters directly below you, continuing along in its downward spiral.  The walkway extends along the rim of the volcano to the east, gently curving to the north as it does so.  To the south you see the smooth tunnels.

rooms.name: On a Stone Walkway
rooms.description: The stone walkway seems to wind endlessly around the rim of the volcano. Examining the walkway itself, you are startled to discover that it has no supports of any kind; rather, it seems to be directly fused with the rim of the volcano.  A terrible fear overcomes you and you irrationally clutch the stone railing of this walkway.  After a time you regain your emotional balance and begin your slow spiral along the walkway.  The walkway extends along the rim of the volcano to the north and south.  To the north, you see that the walkway curves to the west and brings you to a point which is opposite the beginning of this walkway.  To the south, the walkway also curves to the west, and will lead you to the beginning of the walkway.

rooms.name: On a Stone Walkway
rooms.description: The stone walkway seems to wind endlessly around the rim of the volcano. Examining the walkway itself, you are startled to discover that it has no supports of any kind; rather, it seems to be directly fused with the rim of the volcano.  A terrible fear overcomes you and you irrationally clutch the stone railing of this walkway.  After a time you regain your emotional balance and begin your slow spiral along the walkway.  The walkway extends along the rim of the volcano to the west and east.  The walkways curve gently to the south in both directions.

The walkway extends along the rim of the volcano the the north and south.  The walkways gently curve to the east in both directions.

rooms.name: On a Stone Walkway
rooms.description: The stone walkway seems to wind endlessly around the rim of the volcano. Examining the walkway itself, you are startled to discover that it has no supports of any kind; rather, it seems to be directly fused with the rim of the volcano.  A terrible fear overcomes you and you irrationally clutch the stone railing of this walkway.  After a time you regain your emotional balance and begin your slow spiral along the walkway.  The walkway extends along the inner rim of the volcano to the west and east.  The walkways curve gently to the north in both directions.

rooms.name: On a Stone Walkway
rooms.description: The stone walkway seems to wind endlessly around the rim of the volcano. Peering down over the railing, you observe a column of stone rising from the darkness.  The darkness surrounds the column on all sides, a moat no army could cross.  Rising from the flattened surface of the column is a delicate tower made of a white stone.  It shines like a beacon in your light, but a chill overcomes you as you look upon the spire.  As you study the structure further, you finally notice that below you, the stone walkway cuts across the darkness and connects to the base of the spire.  The walkway extends along the rim of the volcano to the north and south.  The walkways curve gently to the west in both directions.

rooms.name: On a Stone Walkway
rooms.description: The stone walkway seems to wind endlessly around the rim of the volcano. Peering down over the railing, you observe a column of stone rising from the darkness.  The darkness surrounds the column on all sides, a moat no army could cross.  Rising from the flattened surface of the column is a delicate tower made of a white stone.  It shines like a beacon in your light, but a chill oversomes you as you look upon the spire.  As you study the structure further, you finally notice that below you, the stone walkway cuts across the darkness and connects to the base of the spire.  The walkway curves around the volcano to the south.  From here the walkway breaks away from the volcano and spans across the darkness, finally connecting to the white tower you spotted from above.

rooms.name: Before the Ivory Tower
rooms.description: The stone walkway connects the tower to the rim of the volcano.  The walkway is rather narrow and you must proceed single-file along its length.  Unlike the walkway which spirals along the rim, there is no railing here and sweat dampens your forehead as you realize how easy it would be to fall into the darkness. As you close the distance to the tower you realize that the tower is composed of pure ivory.  The walkway ends at a gate to the west and continues to the south, where it melds with the stones of the volcano and begins its upward spiral.

West.description: The gate is stoutly made and appears to be strong enough to resist a battering ram. There is no locking mechanism apparent, and the gate is open.

rooms.name: The Chamber of Reflection
rooms.description: As you enter this room your reflection comes back to you from dozens of mirrors.  You attempt to admire yourself in a mirror but, finding nothing of interest in your battle-scarred visage, turn away in disgust and examine the room.  The mirrors themselves line the walls, the ceiling and even the floor, causing you to step carefully to avoid damaging the fragile looking-glasses. Mirrors also stand freely, and seemingly without support, at random locations in the room.  Of particular interest are oval glasses that decorate the west, north, and south walls, as well as the floor.  The reflection these mirrors cast is filmy and distorted.  Exits from the room are through a gate to the east or up a stairwell that is set in the center of the room.

East.description: The gate is made of stout crosslinked iron. You have no doubt the defenders of this tower, if there are any, would have an easy time preventing intrusion into the tower if the gate were closed and locked. However, it is open now.

extras.text: There mirrors are of varying size but they are all of the finest quality. There are several mirrors which are set apart from the others, however, due to their unusually large size and the odd, filmy reflection they cast. As you peer into one of these unique mirrors you catch of faint glimpse of some outwordly scene the flickers across the surface of the mirror like ripples across water. You also notice that each of the filmy mirrors have an unusually thick frame with a latch on one end and hinges on the others. The frame contains a glass covering which protects the mirror from direct contact with your skin. Now, why would anyone want to put a glass case over a mirror?
It appears that the frame may be opened.

rooms.name: The Guard Room
rooms.description: The floor of this chamber is as black as night itself.  The ebony surface is slick and you have trouble maintaining your footing.  Rising from the floor is a dais composed of pure ivory.  The dais is intricately carved with odd symbols.  A stairwell runs through the center of this chamber.  Above you the stairwell is covered by an old trapdoor.

rooms.name: The Chamber of Crystals
rooms.description: You pass through the trapdoor and step up into the topmost floor of the tower.  The windowless walls of this tower are covered with several different colors of crystals; these crystals reflect your light and fill the chamber with rainbow hues.  Opposite you rises an ivory dais similar to the one in the room below; upon this dais is perched a throne cut from pure, clear crystal.  The only exit is down, through the trapdoor.

rooms.name: Rhalean's Holding Cell
rooms.description: The walls of this room are bleak, the floor barren of furnishings.  A single metal door to the north provides the only exit out of the cell.  You wail in despair as you realize you will be locked inside this room for all of eternity, or until Rhalean decides to forgive you for whatever sin put you here... Well, or at least until she REMEMBERS she put you here.  Muhahahahahahaha!

rooms.name: Surrounded by Darkness
rooms.description: Here you are, surrounded by darkness, with nothing between you and the center of the earth but air.  You feel sorry for yourself and begin to review your life.  It is not a long life but you have plenty of time so you spend much time contemplating it.  Resigned at your fate, you lace your hands behind your head, and, elbows sticking out like awkward wings, try to make yourself as comfortable as possible.

rooms.name: Deep Beneath the Earth
rooms.description: Shakily, you examine your surroundings.  The bottom of this pit is very warm; the rock is rough and sharp.  Looking above you, you see nothing but the pit leading up far beyond the reach of your light.  The weight of the earth and the weight of the darkness seem to press down on you.  You feel very small and insignificant, you worm you.

rooms.name: A Glowing Tunnel
rooms.description: The air here is uncomfortably warm.  The tunnel glows with a white-orange light coming in from the north.  Unlike the ash tunnel, this tunnel is of naturally formed obsidian, and has very little ash or debree in it.  To the west is a small cavern, cramped with sleeping quarters.  To the north is the source of the heat and light you experience here.

rooms.name: At The Burning Wall
rooms.description: The obsidian tunnel narrows dramatically here.  The walls are radiant with a hot white-orange glow.  Immediatly north of you, you come to a dead end of sorts.  The tunnel continues north, but a steady drizzle of lava and fire forms an impassable wall.  You are forced to turn back south.

rooms.name: Near A Side Vent
rooms.description: The open sea air is surprisingly refreshing.  A side vent to the south leads into the volcano.  A small path runs along the volcano face.  The sea stretches out endlessly to the north.  If you are careful to avoid the drizzling lava, you could go south into the volcano.  The only other exit is west on the face.

rooms.name: North Face of the Volcano
rooms.description: You find yourself on the north face of the volcano, its peak rising above you on the south, and in every other direction, the ocean.  The ground on which you stand is on an extreme slant, and very loose beneath your feet.  All you can discern from this vantage is the basalt landslide in which you find yourself.  You can work your way east or west along the volcano.

rooms.name: North Face of the Volcano
rooms.description: You find yourself on the north face of the volcano, its peak rising above you on the south, and in every other direction, the ocean.  The ground on which you stand is on an extreme slant, and very loose beneath your feet.  All you can disern from this vantage is the basalt landslide in which you find yourself.  You can work your way downward to the east or straight up the volcano.

rooms.name: A Basalt Ledge
rooms.description: The otherwise loose rock forms a solid shelf here.  From this ledge you can sea seemingless endless ocean.  The water get turbulent as it nears the rocky shores of Fiery Island.  The volcano fumes behind you from minor vents. Though the ocean breaze keeps the air comfortable, yuo can feel the heat radiating up from the ground.

rooms.name: Basalt Shelf
rooms.description: Solid rock walls surround you on 3 sides, with the north opening up to a ledge above the sea.  The wind is still here, blocked by the volcanos rock walls.  Scorch marks mar the area, as if some mage battles had taken place here recently.
